result.execSummary:
The defendant Billy James Sommers was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Billy James Sommers is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Billy James Sommers was found guilty of Theft-Movable Property >$10,000 [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "G" Felony], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Restitution $860.00. eif

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb,ADA:  Alexis S. Mckinley   DF ATTY:  John A. Kucinski   DF:  Billy James Sommers appeared from St. Cloud Correctional Facility by permission of the court.  Court called.  DE files a Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights Form with the Court as Ex. 1 O/R.   Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights.  Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads Guilty to Ct 1.  Crt reviews the police reports.   Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1. On motion of the State without objecton, Crt dismisses Ct 2. Sentencing arguments. Crt orders:

Ct. 1 in 15CF276
- DE sentenced to 45 days in the St. Croix County Jail with credit for time served
- Letter of apology to the St. Croix County Tree Service to be written in 10 days from todays hearing.  
- Civil Judgment for restitution in the amount of $860.00 
- Court costs of $268.00 and $250.00 to be paid through his parole agent Ken Kalla
- 20 days to appeal
Filed by Atty Kucinski. Re: Hearing on 6/23/2016. Reviewed by EJL. km

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA:  Kenneth N. Sortedahl, DF ATTY:  Alex Andrea for John A. Kucinski   DF:  Billy James Sommers appeared.  Case recalled at 10:39 a.m.  State files an Information with the court.  DE reviews the Information.  Court informs Def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands.  DE pleads Not Guilty on all counts.  Not Guilty plea is entered.  DE waives speedy trial.  Bail is continued.  Set out for PTC.  Court adjourned at 10:41 a.m.  lw

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Kenneth N. Sortedahl, DF ATTY: Alex Andrea for John A. Kucinski, DF: Billy James Sommers did not appear.  Court called at 10:36 a.m. Set for preliminary hearing.  DE files with the court the Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver.  Court questions the DE.   Court finds that DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives right to a preliminary hearing.  Court finds probable cause that a felony was probably committed and the DE probably committed one and binds the DE over for trial.  Bail is continued.  Court adjourned at 10:38 a.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 21, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Preliminary hearing at 07-31-2015 10:30 am
Per EJL 6/30/15 - Faxed Dispatch and Sheriff.  eif
Preliminary hearing at 07-31-2015 10:30 am

Bond is to be Co-Signed by  Cathy Sommers

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  St. Croix Tree Service or the premises.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
